name: Azithromycin dihydrate
indications: azithromycin macrolide antibacterial indicated treatment patients mild moderate infections caused susceptible strains designated microorganisms conditions listed .
contraindications: [ usage ( 1 ) ] azithromycin taken without food . however , increased tolerability observed tablets taken food . pediatric suspension prescribing information azithromycin oral suspension 100 mg/5 ml 200 mg/5 ml bottles .

indications_original: Azithromycin is a macrolide antibacterial drug indicated for the treatment of patients with mild to moderate infections caused by susceptible strains of the designated microorganisms in the specific conditions listed below.
contraindications_original:
[see Indications and Usage (1)]
                  
                  Azithromycin can be taken with or without food. However, increased tolerability has been observed when tablets are taken with food.
                  For pediatric suspension see the prescribing information for azithromycin for oral suspension 100 mg/5 mL and 200 mg/5 mL bottles.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Azithromycin Tablets USP, 600 mg (debossed "OE" on one side and "600" on the other side) are supplied as white, oval-shaped, film coated tablets containing azithromycin dihydrate equivalent to 600 mg azithromycin. These are packaged in bottles of 30 tablets:
                  
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           Bottles of 30 tablets with child-resistant closure
                           NDC 51224-222-30
adverseReactions_original: Patients with known hypersensitivity to azithromycin, erythromycin, any macrolide, or ketolide antibiotic. ( 4.1 ) Patients with a history of cholestatic jaundice/hepatic dysfunction associated with prior use of azithromycin. ( 4.2 )
